data.description:
"Floating World" is an ocean-themed survival building game where you must find food and resources to build a shelter and survive each day. your creativity and effort will guide you through this ocean world.

The game features numerous islands, a storyline, and puzzle elements, along with a wealth of building materials and tools. You can experiment with different architectural styles and use various tools to uncover the story of this floating world. üèùÔ∏èüîçüí°

changelog.change_log:
Game update notes:

1.Fixed the issue where using the Building Gun would cause some items to change color and the color effect couldn't be saved.
2.Fixed the issue where items placed in a full backpack would fall into the sea.
3.Fixed some issues with the Large Planting Pots, which can now only be used to plant trees.
4.Fixed the issue where the ship could get stuck and unable to sail when approaching an island.
5.Fixed the issue where items like the Ship Spear had a chance to be placed on the surface of the sea.
6.Changed the mechanism for opening the Watch, it now only requires a light touch to open.
7.The door of the Weather Station will no longer automatically close after being opened.
8.Added explanations for the game modes.
9.Added the Flashlight item, which can be crafted in the Synthesizer and is one of our favorite items.

Fix some small bugs
Turret battery disappears
Reading files will fall into the water
Level Difficulty of Gravity Island

We've just released a small update, version 15.0.1. This update addresses some issues, including a bug where the water kettle was saved as a cup, the garbage collector not properly collecting trash, and a few bugs with the pigs. We've also optimized the engine speed and building resources to make your journey across the ocean smoother and faster.

Novice guide UI optimization
Fix the bug that pigs go through walls

Fix Can't build raft
Modify the garbage map
Added Survival Box Potatoes

Dear Players,

We apologize for the long wait for this update. Our team is small and progress has been slow, especially with the development of the multiplayer version. We understand the frustration and disappointment this has caused, but we assure you that we are doing our best to improve the game within our capabilities.

With this update, we have fixed many of the bugs reported by the community, such as the inability to save, issues with the usage of the storage chests, and optimization of the interaction with items. Additionally, we have improved the tutorials for new players and made changes to the way items are picked up and used. The textures and English language have also been optimized.

We would like to thank you for your support and feedback, and we hope you will continue to enjoy playing A Floating World. We promise to do our best to make the game better for all players.

Sincerely,
The A Floating World Development Team.
